Data: 9.30am Steven Smith has won the toss and Australia will bat
Abbott to Finch, no run short and wide from Abbott to start, a poor ball. Finch goes after his cut but chops it towards the keeper first up. Good stop by de Kock.
Abbott to Finch, 2 runs straighter this time, full and straight, brings this back but Finch squeezes his drive to backward square leg for a couple.

Abbott to Finch, OUT bowled im. One down already. Too exuberant from Finch. But a beautiful delivery too. The perfect delivery to Finch, akin to Southee's ball against Finch in Auckland. Full, just outside off, and so Finch thinks he can hit on the up. But the ball jags back just enough to go through a massive gap between bat and pad. Sends the off stump for a walk. Magnificent start for SA.
Abbott to Smith, no run full outside off, 136 kph. Lovely length, inviting some swing. Gets just enough away swing. Respectfully left
Abbott to Smith, no run brings it back again. Moving the ball both ways. Drags the length back a tad, Smith misses his flick and is struck high on the back leg.
Abbott to Smith, no run beautiful over. Lovely channels. Back of a length outside off, Smith goes back and gets his head over the ball to say that's enough for now.

Pretorius to Warner, 1 run wonderful batting from Warner. Rather full outside off, Warner checks his drive towards mid-off. Sees an opportunity for run and gets to the other end. A real classy single, something he has developed a lot since his finger injury
Pretorius to Smith, no run 136 kph, these are good lengths, full again. Not a lot of swing and so Smith can easily block to mid-on
Pretorius to Smith, 1 run too straight this time, Smith walks across and tucks this down to fine leg. Out if he missed but he rarely misses

Pretorius to Warner, FOUR runs awesome stuff. Not a bad delivery at all. Back of a length on middle and off. He just backs away a touch to make some room and angle his bat to get the ball through extra cover. Just a punch for four.
Pretorius to Warner, no run brings this straighter, middle and leg on the same length. Worked to midwicket
Pretorius to Warner, 1 run a bit of a leading edge. 136 kph, down leg, gets a run to deep square

Abbott to Warner, OUT one more. Abbott has another. What a jaffa. Australia's openers have been bowled in 13 balls. Continues to be full on off and middle, but this tails back exaggeratedly. Goes through a gap between bat and pad again, and disturbs the stumps. Warner visibly late in picking the movement. Superb start from Abbott.
Abbott to Bailey, no run full again, on middle and leg. 130.6 kph, not very pacey but naggingly accurate. Blocked
Abbott to Bailey, no run good length on off, high 120s. Comes back in, keeps low too. Defended
Abbott to Bailey, no run 128.5 kph, full and straight, some nip back. Bailey blocks
Abbott to Bailey, 1 run 131 kph, good length outside off. A thick outside edge gets Bailey one down to third man
Abbott to Smith, 2 runs too straight to Smith. A good ball to most others. Back of a length on off or just outside. Smith shuffles across and flicks in the gap at midwicket for a couple
Pretorius to Bailey, no run full on off, pushed to mid-off. Not much movement for Pretorius

Pretorius to Bailey, OUT Bailey gone now. Australia in all sorts. Bailey doesn't review, and rightly so. Plumb in front. Good length on off and middle. Bailey sees the length and stays back, but should have come forward because of the variable bounce. It keeps low, jags back in and pins Bailey plumb in front. Didn't have much chance once he hung on that back foot
Pretorius to Marsh, no run 128 kph, back of a length outside off, blocked.
Pretorius to Marsh, no run 126 kph, full and straight. Marsh's feet stuck in the crease, defended
Pretorius to Marsh, no run 131 kph, good length and straight. Defended to mid-on
Pretorius to Marsh, FOUR runs poor ball. Drifts down leg and Marsh puts it away. A neat flick through square leg gets Marsh four
Abbott to Smith, no run back of a length on off, Smith shuffles across again and works to square leg. Got to watch for that late inswinger
Abbott to Smith, no run 125 kph, the pace getting slower but the accuracy unerring. Full, straight and blocked to mid-on
Abbott to Smith, no run lovely bowling, attacking Smith's pads and you won't hear that too often. Full on middle, the ball comes back. Smothered to short midwicket
Abbott to Smith, 1 run good length on off, nudged down to fine leg for a run
Abbott to Marsh, no run 129 kph, back of a length outside off, may have moved away just a tad. Blocked to cover

Abbott to Marsh, no run beautiful shot. Overly full on off, a rare half volley. The full face of the bat offered by Marsh, straight back to Abbott who parries the ball to mid-on. Saved four in his follow-through
Pretorius to Smith, no run nice lines. Fuller than a good length outside off, pushed towards mid-off. Head over the ball
Pretorius to Smith, 1 run 131 kph, rather full again on middle and leg, a neat drive to mid-on, who is slightly deep.
Pretorius to Marsh, no run good length outside off, keeping it there. Left. No slips now.
Pretorius to Marsh, no run 134 kph, fullish down leg, driven to mid-on
Pretorius to Marsh, no run very tight stuff from Pretorius. Nothing loose. Full and straight again, a checked muscular drive finds mid-on
Pretorius to Marsh, no run 132 kph, outside off and full. Defended. Just one off
Abbott to Smith, no run more signs of the slowness of the surface. Good length outside off, Smith tries to punch a drive through the covers but skews it to midwicket instead.
Abbott to Smith, no run 131 kph, nice line outside off. Smith awkwardly pushes to mid-off. Seemed a premeditated front-foot movement

Abbott to Smith, no run extra bounce this time. Good length outside off, Smith shuffles across, looks to defend but some bounce takes the shoulder of Smith's bat. Wry smiles from both batsman and bowler
Abbott to Smith, 1 run 132 kph, nice lines to Smith: his off-stump channel which is slightly wide outside off. A thick outside edge to third man
Abbott to Marsh, 1 run good length on middle, 135 kph. thick inside edge down to fine leg

Abbott to Smith, FOUR runs shot. To be fair to Abbott, it wasn't short enough to pull. But Smith had had enough of plodding about. Good length on off, he picks the length early and nails his cross-batted swat over square leg. No bother in trying to keep that down
Pretorius to Marsh, no run dead straight. Full on middle, a neat straight drive hits the stumps at the other end
Pretorius to Marsh, no run back of a length on middle, sits up for Marsh as he goes back and defends with his head right over the ball
Pretorius to Marsh, no run pushed towards mid-on with the full face
Pretorius to Marsh, no run 131 kph, probably the first ball today that has gone to point, an indication of how accurate these opening bowlers have been. Good length outside off, cut to point
Pretorius to Marsh, no run rather full this time, sweetly-timed drive to a short mid-off. Amla dives, fields and elicits raucous wonder from the crowd
Pretorius to Marsh, no run back of a length outside off, pushed towards cover from the back foot. Another tight over. Lovely start
Abbott to Smith, FOUR runs oh yes. Shot of the day. Aided and abetted by a filthy half-volley. Smith comes forward and creams his cover drive. Perfect
Abbott to Smith, no run immediately drags his length slightly back. Not over adjusted, just a tad. Full outside off, and defended
Abbott to Smith, 1 run good length outside off, steered to third man with an angled face
Abbott to Marsh, no run 129 kph, fuller length outside off. Jammed into the off side
Abbott to Marsh, no run good length outside off, left alone by Marsh. Continuing those lines outside off
Abbott to Marsh, no run 125 kph, a nice fluid drive to cover from marsh. These two starting to open up
Pretorius to Smith, no run superb. Full on a fifth-stump line, which is the perfect channel to Smith. Defended
Pretorius to Smith, no run 135 kph, keeps a tad low again. Fullish on off, squeezed away to midwicket from the crease. Can't be tentative in footwork on this surface
Pretorius to Smith, 1 run back of a length outside off, Smith goes across and nudges one to midwicket. Not a bad ball
Pretorius to Marsh, no run slower offcutter on middle. Makes sure it's straight so if it goes wrong, it has to be a very good shot to get a boundary. it isn't wrong and so Marsh defends
Pretorius to Marsh, no run 132 kph outside off, drive to short mid-off. Marsh looks to hit that on the up but again mis-times it
Pretorius to Marsh, no run back of a length on middle, blocked.
Shamsi to Smith, no run a lot of flight on middle, driven back to the bowler
Shamsi to Smith, 1 run too much flight this time, 101 kph. Overpitched and Smith creams his on-drive to long-on
Shamsi to Marsh, no run nice, 81 kph. Drags the length back, slightly shorter. Draws Marsh forward who somehow keeps it out
Shamsi to Marsh, 1 run he'll be happy to get off strike. Absolutely struggled to SL's Lakshan Sanadakan in the Tests did Marsh. Drives this to mid-off
Shamsi to Smith, 1 run this man didn't though. Reads the wrong un and pushes to long-off. Superb player of spin
Shamsi to Marsh, no run good variation but too short. Another googly, Marsh goes deep, may have read it off the pitch and punched to cover
Phehlukwayo to Smith, no run loosener to start, floats this one full at 135 kph. Smith defends
Phehlukwayo to Smith, no run 132 kph, full on off, nice drive back to the bowler. Full face of the bat. That movement from earlier has ceased
Phehlukwayo to Smith, 1 run good length on off, Smith shuffles across and works to backward square. Wants two but deep square leg is quick on it
Phehlukwayo to Marsh, 1 wide wanted to test the middle of the pitch, the first we have seen today. Bouncer down leg, tennis-ball bounce, loops over the batsman's head
Phehlukwayo to Marsh, 1 run nice drive. Rather full outside off, driven on the up to deep cover
Phehlukwayo to Smith, 1 run dhort delivery on off, sits up for Smith to swat to deep square leg. Rolled his wrists to keep it down
Phehlukwayo to Marsh, no run good length outside off, 135 kph. Pushed to point from the back foot
Shamsi to Smith, no run flat down leg, 80 kph. Misses his flick does Smith and gets rapped on the pad. Throws his head back in disgust
Shamsi to Smith, 1 run flatter, quicker, shorter on off. Smith remains calm and punches to deep cover for one
Shamsi to Marsh, no run 81 ks, quick outside off, flies off the bat to cover. Sweet drive
Shamsi to Marsh, 1 run persists with a quick pace. Flat outside off, pushed to cover. Angled bat, gets one
Shamsi to Smith, no run flights this one up on middle, pushed back to the bowler
Shamsi to Smith, no run 84 kph, tossed up on middle and leg, a bit of spin, not extravagant. Shovelled to midwicket

Phehlukwayo to Marsh, FOUR runs ah yes, shot. Not a good delivery on a slow surface. A short delivery on middle and leg, sits up for Marsh to pummel through midwicket with a cross-bat swat. Put away, just what you do when you're not fluent
Phehlukwayo to Marsh, no run back of a length on middle, Marsh hangs back and punches to mid-on
Phehlukwayo to Marsh, no run looks to go straight over the infield. Full on off, Marsh skews to midwicket. Just not a good shot on this surface. Definitely a slower pitch
Phehlukwayo to Marsh, no run good comeback this from AP. Keeping it tight outside off, steers to point
Phehlukwayo to Marsh, FOUR runs short again and shot again. A bouncer that doesn't get up at all. Back of a length on off, Marsh doesn't go back, pulls through midwicket while on the front foot
Phehlukwayo to Marsh, 1 run and now drifts down leg, worked to fine leg for a single
Shamsi to Marsh, no run flat on middle, slow turn. Marsh stays back and has enough time to nudge to midwicket
Shamsi to Smith, no run overpitched outside off, googly. Skewed to cover with the direction of spin

Shamsi to Smith, OUT quite close. Big appeal, but too much doubt, I'd say. Faf and his close fielders have a chat, and he decides to review. Nice flight outside off from Shamsi, it turns back in and hits Smith in front of off. This could be closer than I thought initially. No bat. Umpire's call? rRemember, there is a new lbw protocol. in force. Those new lbw rules aren't needed because it struck him in front of off and hits o
Shamsi to Head, no run ah, beauty. Flight outside off, this one spins and beats the outside edge. Hands on heads

Shamsi to Head, OUT one more! Shamsi has two in three. Another one for SA. Head has a chat with his partner and opts not to review. Australia in tatters now. Another orthodox delivery, flat on off. The ball spins a touch and beats Head's outside edge to strike him in front of off. Was there too much spin? Would it have been umpire's call? Head did not pick either delivery. Australia have been left befuddled by a few deliverie
Phehlukwayo to Marsh, no run good length outside off, tapped to point.
Phehlukwayo to Marsh, 1 run full and wide outside off, smashed to the sweeper cover.
Phehlukwayo to Wade, no run good length on off, worked to midwicket
Phehlukwayo to Wade, no run bouncer, good change-up, well directed too. Wade gets underneath
Phehlukwayo to Wade, 1 run too straight, drifts down leg and clipped down to fine leg to get off the mark
Phehlukwayo to Marsh, 1 run overly full outside off again, a nice drive to deep cover for a run
Shamsi to Marsh, no run flatter and quicker on middle, Marsh goes back and works to midwicket
Shamsi to Marsh, 1 run the wrong 'un this time outside off. Marsh hurries back and punches a drive to long-off

Shamsi to Wade, 2 runs a bit of a streaky stroke. A wristspinner will always extract extra bounce because of the additional revs imparted on the ball. As a result, that sweep stroke os fraught with risk. Top edged to backward square leg, on the bounce
Shamsi to Wade, no run darts this flat outside off, steered to point
Shamsi to Wade, 1 run flat outside off, punched to long-on. Wade almost shoulder-charges into Shamsi. Absolutely no reason for that. Left his elbow hanging out
Shamsi to Marsh, no run beautiful end. Gets this to slide past Marsh's tentative outside edge, hits him on the pad, but umpire's call oin impact with stumps. A bit of a muted appeal there
Phehlukwayo to Wade, no run 127 kph, full and straight, gets this to come back. Blocked
Phehlukwayo to Wade, no run
Phehlukwayo to Wade, no run lovely channels on off, 137 kph. Nothing Wade can do but block. When he has been further up, Phehlukwayo has been good
Phehlukwayo to Wade, no run nice shot. Good length outside off, a bit of width. Scythed but straight to Duminy at backward point
Phehlukwayo to Wade, no run good length outside off, may have taken some pace off the ball. Wade misses his cut.
Phehlukwayo to Wade, no run superb over. A maiden. Full outside off, smothered to mid-on off the inside half of the bat
Shamsi to Marsh, 1 run tossed up outside off, driven to long-off.
Shamsi to Wade, no run the googly on middle and leg, Wade reads him off the pitch and nudges to midwicket. A long hard stare from Shamsi, Wade looks away
Shamsi to Wade, no run flight on middle and leg, solidly blocked
Shamsi to Wade, no run more flight, but this is the googly and is slightly short. Worked away to midwicket
Shamsi to Wade, no run 77 kph, tossed up on off, another googly. Inside-halved to midwicket. Wade doing the right thing by keeping most out for now
Shamsi to Wade, FOUR runs short and wide outside off, Wade chops a cut down to the third man boundary. May have got there a tad late but four the result.
Phangiso to Marsh, 1 run loads of flight on off, pushed down to long-on
Phangiso to Wade, 1 run that's a batter shot to this type of spin. Slow outside off, Wade gets low and helps a paddle sweep to fine leg. Safe
Phangiso to Marsh, 1 run tripe. A rank long-hop outside off. Marsh rocks back and looks to send it into the stands but keeps low and he can only drag a pull to deep midwicket

Phangiso to Wade, FOUR runs nice stroke. Flat outside off, Wade goes back and punches this through cover. Pretorius labours after it, gets there but misses his attempt to pull the ball back. May have been surprised by the quickness of the outfield
Phangiso to Wade, no run pushed towards midwicket, Phangiso gets across and fields
Phangiso to Wade, no run 90 ks, quick on middle, turned away to midwicket
Shamsi to Marsh, no run another beauty. But not badly played. Played the off stump line. If the ball, turned back in, he has it covered. If it goes on, like it did, it beats the bat. Good batting.
Shamsi to Marsh, no run flatter outside off, hurriedly pushed to cover
Shamsi to Marsh, 1 run another googly, but too slow, and too short. Marsh goes back and works to square leg
Shamsi to Wade, 1 run no turn, slides on to Wade's inside edge. Almost gets through. One to square leg
Shamsi to Marsh, no run overpitched outside off, drilled to Amla at short mid-off
Shamsi to Marsh, 1 run the googly. Picks it nicely, short and wide, cut to deep point
Phehlukwayo to Marsh, 2 runs good batting. Full outside off, steered past point for a couple. Played that late
Phehlukwayo to Marsh, no run short, back of a length and slow. Hammered off the back foot to mid-off
Phehlukwayo to Marsh, FOUR runs superb shot. Overpitched outside off, drilled down to the mid-off boundary. Uppish but safe. Nice batting
Phehlukwayo to Marsh, 1 run good length on middle, pushed down to long-on. Playing it nicely now is Marsh
Phehlukwayo to Wade, FOUR runs beautiful batting. Awesome stuff from Wade. Overpitched outside off, Wade times his cover drive, and finds the gap through cover.
Phehlukwayo to Wade, 1 run bouncer on middle, Wade rides the bounce, keeps it down and finds one to fine leg
Phangiso to Wade, 1 run flight on off, pushed down to long-on with the spin, easy single

Phangiso to Marsh, FOUR runs oh my. Watch out. Flight outside off, Marsh hurries to the pitch with nimble footwork and does what he does best. Smashes it back with immense power. The bowler hurriedly takes his hands away
Phangiso to Marsh, 1 run driven to long-off with the spin
Phangiso to Wade, 1 run shortish on off, Wade goes back and punches to long-on, good batting by these two
Phangiso to Marsh, no run flat again, Marsh goes back, pushes towards long-on but Faf gets across from midwicket
Phangiso to Marsh, no run almost goes through. A non-turning delivery on off, played back
Duminy to Wade, no run flat delivery on off, no turn. Wade goes back and punches back to the bowler
Duminy to Wade, 1 run use of the feet, gets to the pitch and pushed down to long-on
Duminy to Marsh, SIX runs absolutely no trouble in finding six once he got to the pitch. Runs down, gets there and just flicks the ball in the air. Whistles over the midwicket boundary
Duminy to Marsh, no run slides on with the arm and beats the bat. Well bowled. Marsh played for some spin
Duminy to Marsh, no run flatter delivery on middle and leg, played back

Duminy to Marsh, 1 run more tripe. Short outside off, Marsh goes back and hammers his pull to deep midwicket, all along the ground. Rossouw at midwicket tries to field, but the ball hits his hand and goes through
Phangiso to Marsh, 1 run flat on off, pushed down the ground for a single
Phangiso to Wade, no run flight outside off, a solid block
Phangiso to Wade, no run flatter trajectory outside off, no turn. Wade goes back, plays it back
Phangiso to Wade, no run Wade comes down but Phangiso shortens the length, not near the pitch. Hits the pad
Phangiso to Wade, no run flight outside off, blocked
Phangiso to Wade, no run another flat, short delivery outside off. Punched back
Duminy to Marsh, 1 run strays down leg, flicked away to deep midwicket
Duminy to Wade, 1 run flight outside off, angles his bat at the last instant to find one through sweeper cover
Duminy to Marsh, 1 run flat on leg, marsh comes down and pushes to long-on
Duminy to Wade, 1 run short and wide outside off, cut away easily to deep point
Duminy to Marsh, 1 run slower through the air, drags it back too. Worked to deep square leg
Duminy to Wade, no run flight outside off, nice length. Wade blocks
Phangiso to Marsh, no run flat on middle and leg, pushed back to the bowler. Hardly any turn
Phangiso to Marsh, no run full and flat, driven back again
Phangiso to Marsh, 1 run slow through the air, outside off, Marsh opens the face to steer a ball to deep cover to get to a vital fifty. Quality innings so far
Phangiso to Wade, no run slow outside off, pushed back
Phangiso to Wade, no run darted on leg, nudged to fine leg
Phangiso to Wade, 1 run slow again on middle, worked down towards fine leg, one more
Abbott to Wade, FOUR runs oh superb batting. Short on middle, sits up for Wade who pulls this behind square. Keeps it down, finds the gap. All requisites for boundary-scoring. Quality
Abbott to Wade, no run good length on off, blocked
Abbott to Wade, 1 run isn't great bowling from Abbott after a lovely opening spell. Short down leg, pulled down to fine leg

Abbott to Marsh, OUT gone! Abbott returns to an impeccable length and line, and reaps a reward immediately. Massive wicket, massive moment in the game. Just goes slightly wide of the crease, a fuller than good length outside off. Marsh pokes and gets a thick outside edge to de Kock. Superb bowling. Big big breakthrough. Quality knock but could have done more

Abbott to Hastings, FOUR runs back of a length and width outside off, 135ks, Hastings late-cuts it to the left of backward point, beat's third man's dive to his right. Excellent stroke. A+ for timing as well as placement
Abbott to Hastings, no run good length and on off, right behind the line in defence
Shamsi to Wade, 1 run turns away outside off, slightly short, chopped to backward point

Shamsi to Hastings, OUT Shamsi returns and strikes! Tossed up nicely and spins back into the right-hander. Hastings has a short stride as he looks to defend with a straight bat. He, however, looks to defend outside the line. Shami beats him on the inside and raps the front pad below the knee-roll in front of middle. The finger goes up, and Hastings knew he was gone. Din't bother to review. The tracker shows that it would take
Shamsi to Zampa, no run skids into the thigh, diverted behind to short fine leg
Shamsi to Zampa, 1 run loopier around off, opens the face and runs the ball towards cover-point
Shamsi to Wade, no run much fuller on off, straight delivery, defended
Shamsi to Wade, no run Wade presses forward and defends this well-flighted delivery on off stump
Abbott to Zampa, FOUR runs good length ball on off, Zampa opens the face and threads the off-side field with a drive

Abbott to Zampa, OUT bowled 'em! The off stump is floored. What a sight for a fast bowler! Good-length ball angled into the right-hander. Then straightens and beats the skittish waft of Zampa. Abbott barges into Zampa's castle and takes him down. The batsman was probably aiming to run the ball through vacant slip. No dice...
Abbott to Tremain, no run back of a length and outside off, pushed down the ground to mid-off
Abbott to Tremain, no run back of a length and on a fourth-stump line, blocked back towards the bowler
Abbott to Tremain, no run presses forward and taps this length ball from outside off to the covers
Abbott to Tremain, 2 runs full and on off and middle, Tremain whips it in the gap between midwicket and mid-on
Shamsi to Tremain, no run flighted and full on middle, played back to the bowler
Shamsi to Tremain, no run slower and spins into the right-hander, defended
Shamsi to Tremain, SIX runs sees some air on middle, goes low, and slog-sweeps over square leg
Shamsi to Tremain, no run skidding across the right-hander, much quicker and flatter. Blocked
Shamsi to Tremain, FOUR runs Tremain gives it a good ol' thump! Down the track, meets the pitch of this full ball and hits it down the ground for four
Shamsi to Tremain, no run slides on quicker on the stumps, blocked out
Pretorius to Wade, 1 run pitched up and angling away outside off, driven to mid-off, where the fielder fumbles and gives a single
Pretorius to Tremain, no run full and angled in, the bat comes down at an angle as well. Defended towards midwicket
Pretorius to Tremain, no run pitched up and angled in, shuffled across and poked towards the midwicket region
Pretorius to Tremain, 1 wide dragged down the leg side, wide
Pretorius to Tremain, 1 run length and outside off, opens the face and glides a single to third man. Australia get to 150
Pretorius to Wade, no run he rolls his fingers across the offcutter, dips under the swing of Wade en route to the keeper. Beaten
Pretorius to Wade, FOUR runs good length and outside off, Wade attacks it. Goes against the angle and kerplunks it over mid-on for a boundary
Shamsi to Wade, 1 run rolls his wrists, the sweep is Wade's safety blanket. He takes it from outside off and hits to deep midwicket
Shamsi to Tremain, 1 wide breaking down the leg side, draws the batsman forward and beats him. Leg-side wide
Shamsi to Tremain, 2 runs straight delivery on middle, Tremain goes low, and unfurls a sweep of his own. Guided to long leg
Shamsi to Tremain, no run slides on middle, blocked from the crease with a straight bat
Shamsi to Tremain, 1 run pushed through full and outside off, front-foot drive to long-off
Shamsi to Wade, no run how did that miss the off stump? Phew! Shami has his hands on his head. Looped up, turns slightly, Wade pre-meditated a sweep, and lost his shape. Beaten
Shamsi to Wade, 1 run Wade succeeds now, sweeping a single to short fine leg
Abbott to Wade, 1 run slinks down the track, meets a half-volley and clouts it down the ground to mid-off. Faf nimbly moves to his right and dives to stop the ball
Abbott to Tremain, no run pretty full on off, Tremain plants his front foot down and lashes it back to the bowler
Abbott to Tremain, 1 run short and outside off, waits and glides a single to third man
Abbott to Wade, no run length and angling away outside off, shoots low, beats the wild swipe from Wade
Abbott to Wade, no run and again! Wade pre-meditates again. Rushes down the track. The bowler alters his length - drags it short - he can't connect with the leg-side mow again

Abbott to Wade, SIX runs Wade mows a six finally! Shortish on the leg stump, Wade sizes this up and launches it over FB into the stands beyond deep backward square leg. FB leapt to his left, stretched his left hand, but the ball evaded him
Shamsi to Tremain, no run good-length ball, breaking into the leg stump, hangs back and helps it to short fine leg
Shamsi to Tremain, no run tossed up and spins in, deflected square through the leg side, more off the inside half
Shamsi to Tremain, no run flighted on off, plants his front leg down the line and pushes it back to Shamsi
Shamsi to Tremain, no run slower through the air outside off, blocked on the front foot. Good, confident stride from Tremain
Shamsi to Tremain, no run he sits back to this full ball on middle and dabs to extra-cover
Shamsi to Tremain, no run hangs it in the air outside off, blocked on the front foot. Well done, Shamsi. Finishes with career-best returns of 3-36
Pretorius to Wade, SIX runs Wade reaches his half-century with a six. He dares to race at Pretorious. He pulled his length back, but the batsman still slap-pulled it over square leg
Pretorius to Wade, 1 run Wade paddle-sweeps this length ball to fine leg
Pretorius to Tremain, FOUR runs good length and outside off, drives away from the body and sends an outside edge fine on the off side, third man was rather square
Pretorius to Tremain, 2 runs shortish on off, pulled through backward square leg for a couple
Pretorius to Tremain, no run good length and homing in on off, played back to the bowler on the front foot
Pretorius to Tremain, no run shortens his length on middle, camps back and blocks back to the bowler

Phangiso to Wade, OUT Phangiso belts out an appeal for lbw, it's given! Wade wants a review, more out of hope rather than conviction. He's also Australia's last hope. Pushed through from over the wicket, starts outside off, and spins in. Wade goes low for the sweep and misses. Struck on the thigh in line with the stumps. The tracker shows it would hit the leg stump
Phangiso to Boland, no run skids fast on middle, run back to the bowler from the crease
Phangiso to Boland, no run pitched up on off, defended

Phangiso to Boland, OUT Phangiso strikes the pad, again! Draws another leg-before appeal. The bowler isn't sure. Qdk insists on a review, and Faf goes for it. Inside edge? Replays show pad first! Tossed up full, drifts in. Straightens enough. It would have hit middle. Australia have been dismissed for 167

SA rested three-first choice bowlers but still wiped out Australia for 167 in 36.4 overs. Abbott led the way with the new ball before Shamsi, the left-arm wristspinner, took over and ended with career-best returns of 3 for 36. The story could have been worse for the visitors if not for fifities from Wade and Marsh. We'll be back soon for the chase.

12.45pm Tabraiz Shamsi: It is a good feeling, and hopefully we win this one as well. The main thing is pitching in line with the stumps and the surface does the rest. Australia is a quality side, our bowlers did a great job. We should be able to chase it down."
1pm And we're back. Qdk and Amla are out in the middle. Can Tremain find some movement with the new ball? Over the wicket, one slip
Tremain to Amla, no run full inswinger, hits the pad, as Amla shuffles outside off from outside leg. Yes, he found movement, but this was definitely slipping down leg
Tremain to Amla, no run almost yorker-length, swings into Amla again. He hurriedly jabs his bat down and digs to mid-on
Tremain to Amla, no run full on middle and leg, jammed out towards midwicket
Tremain to Amla, FOUR runs veering into the pads of Amla again, he cashes in this time. Sweetly flicking this leg-stump half-volley past midwicket
Tremain to Amla, no run pitched up on middle, Amla shuffles across off and defends to midwicket
Tremain to Amla, no run Amla moves across off stump again, defends this good-length ball in front of middle
Boland to de Kock, no run good length and just a shade outside off, bunted towards midwicket
Boland to de Kock, no run shout of lbw, Smith ponders and shoots down the possibility of a review. Good length and catches him on the shuffle, but it had pitched outside leg
Boland to de Kock, no run full and angled away outside off, front-foot drive to mid-off
Boland to de Kock, no run full and angling away outside off, whipped out to midwicket
Boland to de Kock, 2 runs too straight in line, picked away through midwicket
Boland to de Kock, 2 runs whipped from off stump to square leg, where there is a misfield
Tremain to Amla, no run back of a length and angled in at off, Amla keeps back and punches to short extra cover
Tremain to du Plessis, no run good length and angled in on middle, defended down the pitch to mid-on
Tremain to du Plessis, 1 wide swerving down the leg side, wide
Tremain to du Plessis, 1 run full on middle and leg, firmly whipped through backward square leg
Tremain to de Kock, FOUR runs a bit too full and outside off, Qdk gets forward and crunches a drive, head over the ball, through extra-cover
Tremain to de Kock, 1 wide Tremain retorts with a bouncer angling away from Qdk. Soars to the keeper. Too high and called a wide
Tremain to de Kock, FOUR runs half-volley outside off, Qdk is forward to drive another one through the covers
Boland to du Plessis, no run good length and angled in towards off and middle, defended back down the pitch towards mid-on
Boland to du Plessis, no run good length and in the channel outside off, ignored
Boland to du Plessis, no run tight line on off, tight good-length delivery. Defended
Boland to du Plessis, no run Boland goes wide of the crease and angles it into the right-hander. Straightens a wee bit off the surface and passes the outside edge
Boland to du Plessis, no run just dies in front of Finch at mid-off. Back of a length on off, Faf hops and aims for a punch. Ends up chipping in the air, as the ball stopped at him. He survives
Boland to du Plessis, no run back of a length on the stumps, defended on the back foot
Tremain to de Kock, no run good length and angling away, outside off, defended square on the leg side
Tremain to de Kock, no run much fuller and curls into the left-hander, Qdk falls over on the flick. Pokes an inside edge onto the pad
Tremain to de Kock, 1 run twirls his wrists, whips from outside off through square leg
Tremain to du Plessis, no run good length and angled in towards off, no room, Faf opens the face and check-pushes to extra-cover
Tremain to du Plessis, FOUR runs short and angled in on off, Faf had ample time to rock back and pull over midwicket for his first boundary
Tremain to du Plessis, no run goes full on the stumps, presses forward and drives straight to mid-off
Boland to de Kock, FOUR runs fullish on off and middle, picked up and whipped handsomely through midwicket
Boland to de Kock, 1 run back of a length on middle, Qdk steps away outside leg, manufactures room and cuts, but can't beat backward point
Boland to du Plessis, no run fuller and angled in, Faf stays back, seems like had misjudged the length. Wafted to extra-cover
Boland to du Plessis, no run pitched up and angled in, has a short stride and blocks back down the pitch
Boland to du Plessis, no run Faf skips out of the crease, this is pushed wide outside off. He reaches out with his hands, skewing it off the toe-end towards mid-off
Boland to du Plessis, no run Boland digs it shorter and outside off on seeing Faf skip out again. Slashes an outside edge in the air. Hastings moves in, but the ball drops in front of him
Tremain to Duminy, no run good length on middle from over the wicket, patted to the off side
Tremain to Duminy, no run short and angling away, forced to backward point, flew to Warner, who pulled off a diving stop
Tremain to Duminy, 1 run half-volley outside off, JPD steps forward and drives to the right of mid-off
Tremain to du Plessis, 1 run good length and just outside off, angled down to third man
Tremain to Duminy, 1 run back of a length and angling away, run down to third man
Boland to Duminy, no run good start, full on off. No movement, Duminy blocks.
Boland to Duminy, no run ah lovely. Beautiful shot. Not overpitched, but full. Duminy lays into his drive bit finds cover. Delectable
Boland to Duminy, 1 run good single. Full on off, driven towards mid-off, didn't hit it too well so the run is easy
Boland to du Plessis, no run good length outside off, 135 kph. No movement. Steered to backward point
Boland to du Plessis, no run overly full on middle and leg, driven down towards mid-on. Full bat face
Boland to du Plessis, 1 run flies down to third man. Short and wide, an offering to Faf who top edges his cut for one
Tremain to du Plessis, 1 run nice length. Using his pace and awkward action to extract something. Good length outside off, a hint of away movement. Guided down to third man. Played
Tremain to Duminy, no run back of a length and straight, blocked
Tremain to Duminy, no run full on off, hardly any movement. Pushed back to the bowler
Tremain to Duminy, no run phew, superlative timing but placement isn't superlative so no runs. Drifts down leg, Duminy flicks straight to square leg
Tremain to Duminy, no run nice channel. Keeping it around off, defended. Just don't see Australia's seamers troubling SA without movement.
Tremain to Duminy, no run back of a length on middle and leg, properly played by his feet, soft hands. Another tidy over from Tremain
Boland to du Plessis, no run 136 kph, full on middle and leg, Faf presents the full face of his bat to quell
Boland to du Plessis, no run a tad too much width. Shortish and wide, Faf goes back and slaps to cover from the crease
Boland to du Plessis, no run again, not that wide but Faf punches to cover from the back foot
Boland to du Plessis, no run poor delivery but some tidy fielding from short fine leg. Drifts down leg, worked down to that man who dives to his right
Boland to du Plessis, no run back of a length outside off, hit on the bounce to cover
Boland to du Plessis, no run back of a length, 143 kph, outside off, mis-timed down towards mid-off. Maiden. Another tidy over
Tremain to Duminy, no run good length on leg, 142 kph. Maybe a bit of an inside edge onto the thigh. Dot.
Tremain to Duminy, no run nice change-up, the bouncer outside off. Duminy sways out of the line
Tremain to Duminy, no run overpitched, 139 kph. Driven to cover. Absolutely nothing happening for the seamers. No slips, no movement. This lull in play suits SA just fine
Tremain to Duminy, 2 runs down leg and Duminy gets his legs out of the way to flick past midwicket for a couple
Tremain to Duminy, no run ooh, keeps a tad low. Fullish and wide outside off, toe-ended drive to cover
Tremain to Duminy, no run nicely played. Overpitched on off, Duminy opens his stance and drives to mid-off. Still no run
Boland to du Plessis, 1 run good length outside off, Faf opens the face of his bat to guide one to third man. Easy
Boland to Duminy, no run 144 kph, good length outside off from around the wicket. Slapped to cover. A throw to the non-strikers end in an attempt to soften the ball
Boland to Duminy, 1 wide drifts down leg for a wide, 144 kph
Boland to Duminy, no run overpitched outside off, Duminy gets there too early, ends up is-timing his drive badly to mid-off
Boland to Duminy, no run 138 kph, good length outside off, blocked into the off side
Boland to Duminy, no run good length outside off, driven down to mid-off
Boland to Duminy, no run good length on middle, blocked
Tremain to du Plessis, FOUR runs crashed through the covers. Faf dances down, giving himself room and hammers his cover drive through covers. Sublime timing, a rare occurrence today

Tremain to du Plessis, 1 run drop and run to point. Quality from Faf. Just clever batting. Good length but very close to off, soft hands, taps one to point and gets a positive response from his partner
Tremain to Duminy, no run an optimistic appeal. Full on middle and leg, drifting down leg but not before gets a thick inside edge onto his pad
Tremain to Duminy, no run full on off, driven to mid-off
Tremain to Duminy, 1 run back of a length on middle and leg, Duminy rolls his wrists on that and keeps it down, gets one to deep square leg. Quietly moving it along.

Tremain to du Plessis, 1 run another short delivery which is no trouble at all on this because this surface does not have the pace to hustle batsmen. Faf pulls to deep square leg. Enough time to see it, pick it, and find one with ease
Boland to du Plessis, no run slightly leg side-ish, worked to midwicket
Boland to du Plessis, no run good length outside off, Faf opens the face to guide to point but can't find a run
Boland to du Plessis, 1 run 138 kph, good length on off, pushed to mid-off from the crease. The run is still easy
Boland to Duminy, no run 144.5 kph, seems like 44.5 when it reaches the batsman. Shortish and wide, slapped to cover. Mis-timed badly, the bat handle turns in his hand.
Boland to Duminy, no run good length outside off, pushed to mid-off.
Boland to Duminy, no run overpitched outside off, driven to cover
Hastings to du Plessis, no run good length outside off, 132 kph. Pushed to cover. Faf hanging back

Hastings to du Plessis, 1 run dropped. An absolute sitter. Zampa the culprit. Short delivery on middle, Faf runs down but is hurried by some pace. takes the splice and lobs to Zampa at cover point. Zampa looks up, tries to take it with the fingers pointing down but the ball bursts through, hits him on the chest and drops to the ground. Aargh.
Hastings to Duminy, no run played into the off side.
Hastings to Duminy, no run good length on off, defended into the off side
Hastings to Duminy, no run another good length delivery that is defended
Hastings to Duminy, FOUR runs played. Really good batting. 131 kph, fullish outside off, Duminy opens the face late and guides it through the vacant slip region. So late.
Boland to du Plessis, 2 runs strays down leg, Faf nudges it towards backward square leg and scurries back for two. Did not want that there
Boland to du Plessis, 2 runs and again, this is exactly where he wanted to get it. Down leg, Faf tickles it fine in the same gap - at backward square and earns two
Boland to du Plessis, no run fullish on off, chopped towards point
Boland to du Plessis, 1 run good length outside off, 143 kph. Pushed to mid-off. One
Boland to Duminy, FOUR runs short, wide and put away. Duminy sees width, jumps at the sight of candy and slashes it in front of cover. Four more
Boland to Duminy, no run shortish and wide, defended into the off side
Hastings to du Plessis, 1 leg bye good length on middle and off, Faf shuffles across and misses his flick. Struck right in front, but very high. A leg bye ensues
Hastings to Duminy, FOUR runs four more. Duminy taking over. Too straight, angling down. Worked fine to the fine leg boundary. Juist had to get bat on that, nicely executed
Hastings to Duminy, 1 run good length outside off, carved to third man
Hastings to du Plessis, 1 run good length outside off, steered down to third man
Hastings to Duminy, 1 run nudged down to third man for a run. Another nice single
Hastings to du Plessis, 1 run another single. Good length outside off, pushed away into the gap at cover for one
Zampa to du Plessis, no run shortish and wide outside off, slapped to cover
Zampa to du Plessis, FOUR runs short and wide again, Faf gets a thick outside edge on trying to cut. Gets it hurrying down to third man for four.
Zampa to du Plessis, no run 82 ks, still short on middle, played to midwicket
Zampa to du Plessis, no run tossed up on middle, driven back.
Zampa to du Plessis, 1 run tossed up on off and middle, not short enough to stay back but Faf drives to deep cover. Made one there
Zampa to Duminy, no run flight on middle and off, defended
Hastings to du Plessis, 1 run full outside off, Faf gets right across and drags it to deep square leg. A manufactured run
Hastings to Duminy, no run full on middle, played back
Hastings to Duminy, FOUR runs superb timing again. Overpitched outside off, Duminy strides forward, leans into the drive and sends the ball into the gap at cover point. Nice, confident drive
Hastings to Duminy, no run overpitched on leg, driven to mid-on
Hastings to Duminy, 1 run ooh, out with a direct hit. Pushes to mid-on does JP and calls for one immediately. But Smith at mid-on doesn't pick up cleanly
Hastings to du Plessis, 1 run shortish and wide, chopped to the sweeper cover.
Zampa to du Plessis, 2 runs too short. Flat outside off, sits up for Faf. Drags it from outside off to midwicket, who gets a hand on it
Zampa to du Plessis, 1 run good delivery. Flat, quick. May have been the flipper. Still short enough for Faf to pull to deep square leg
Zampa to Duminy, no run nice flight on leg, kept out

Zampa to Duminy, OUT straight to mid-off. I just despise that shot, but these guys apparently don't. Tossed up on off, Duminy tries to clear mid-off. Doesn't quite get underneath and ends up chipping his wicket away after doing all the hardwork. All he had to do was try to go straight and the margin of error increases multi-fold. Nonetheless, Marsh takes a simple reverse-cupped catch
Tremain to Rossouw, no run yorker on middle and leg, 132.6 kph. Kept out
Tremain to Rossouw, no run full and straight, keeping it tidy. Blocked
Tremain to Rossouw, 1 wide strays down leg, a wide, a free run
Tremain to Rossouw, 2 runs good length down leg, played away into the leg side for a couple.
Tremain to Rossouw, no run overpitched on off, driven back to the bowler
Tremain to Rossouw, 2 runs drifts down leg, Rossouw flicks it away happily through midwicket to get a couple more
Tremain to Rossouw, no run 131 kph, full and wide outside off, hit to mid-off
Zampa to du Plessis, no run well-flighted ball on middle, defended
Zampa to du Plessis, 1 run tossed up further, full on off, backs away and drives inside-out to the left of extra-cover
Zampa to Rossouw, no run slides on outside off, no turn, left alone
Zampa to Rossouw, no run springs out of the crease and quietly blocks this one back to Zampa
Zampa to Rossouw, FOUR runs half-tracker on middle, flipper gone awry, he makes it look worse, rocking back and middling a pull through midwicket
Zampa to Rossouw, no run skids on, no turn again, goes back and punches it to the bowler
Tremain to du Plessis, no run full and on off, tapped into extra-cover
Tremain to du Plessis, FOUR runs a bit too full and outside off, Faf, having backed away outside leg, punchily drives it between extra-cover and mid-off
Tremain to du Plessis, 1 run takes this from off stump and angles a single down to third man
Tremain to Rossouw, no run good length and angled in from around the wicket, presses forward and jabs to mid-on
Tremain to Rossouw, 1 run angled in, nips in further, draws an inside edge and sneaks away towards fine leg
Tremain to du Plessis, 1 run full and at off, Faf carves it away square through the off side, even as the bottom hand flew off the bat
Marsh to du Plessis, no run back of a length on off, Faf stays leg side of the ball as he punches out to cover-point
Marsh to du Plessis, FOUR runs overpitched on off, Faf brings out a drive and drills it down the ground, to the right of Smith at mid-off
Marsh to du Plessis, 2 leg byes angled into the hips, tickled fine on the leg side, past the keeper for leg byes
Marsh to du Plessis, no run back of a length and angled into middle and leg stumps, cramps him for room. Defended back to the bowler
Marsh to du Plessis, 1 run rising short ball on off, Faf glides it towards backward point
Marsh to Rossouw, no run floated up outside off, rocks forward and drives it to the straighter of the two men there
Tremain to du Plessis, no run short and outside off, drags a pull to short midwicket, the fielder throws himself to his right to stop the ball
Tremain to du Plessis, 1 run steered from off stump to backward point for one
Tremain to Rossouw, 1 run shimmies out and meets a short ball. Pulled away to deep midwicket
Tremain to du Plessis, no run pretty full and outside off, driven to mid-off
Tremain to du Plessis, 1 run similar length and line, driven to short extra-cover
Tremain to Rossouw, no run speared full and angled in from round the wicket, jabbed down the ground to mid-on
Marsh to du Plessis, no run leaps back does Faf, gets on top of a short ball and forces it to extra-cover
Marsh to du Plessis, no run good length and angled in on off, guided towards point via an open face
Marsh to du Plessis, 2 runs too full on middle and leg, whipped away square through the leg side. SA's stand-in captain acknowledges his fifty
Marsh to du Plessis, no run bouncer outside off, Faf lets it pass before rehearsing a pull
Marsh to du Plessis, 1 run length ball on off, backs away outside leg and hits it to cover-point
Marsh to Rossouw, no run lifter angled away outside off from the left-hander, Rossouw is happy to let that climb through to the keeper
Boland to du Plessis, 1 run back of a length on off, Faf opens the face and runs a single towards backward point
Boland to Rossouw, no run fractionally short and outside off, does not come onto Rossouw. He seeks to force it through the off side. Ends up dragging an inside edge behind
Boland to Rossouw, no run pitched full and outside off, no shot offered
Boland to Rossouw, FOUR runs width outside off, Rossouw slashes it past backward point. Not all that comfortable is the left-hander. He wrings his hands in pain. Ouch. That finger must be hurting
Boland to Rossouw, no run full and outside off, played up to the covers
Boland to Rossouw, no run back of a length and angled outside off, jabbed into the covers

Marsh to du Plessis, no run Faf has been given out caught behind by umpire Llong. There was a noise. Faf, though, calls for a review almost immediately, suggesting he din't nick that. Bouncer on off, flies past the right shoulder of the batsman. Daylight between the bat and climbing ball. TV umpire Wilson overturns the on-field call. And that's one bouncer for the over
Marsh to du Plessis, 1 run guided past backward point for one
Marsh to Rossouw, no run short and angling away outside off, cut strongly to Bailey at backward point
Marsh to Rossouw, no run back of a length and outside off from round the wicket now, Rossouw rises on top of the bounce, punching to extra-cover

Marsh to Rossouw, no run Rossouw advances down the pitch, Marsh is wary of it, pulling his length back and beating the hook with a cross-seamer. Rossouw actually bailed out of the shot at the last instant
Marsh to Rossouw, no run chopped into the covers as he was cramped for room
Boland to du Plessis, no run shortish on off, punched out to extra-cover
Boland to du Plessis, 2 runs angled in towards leg stump, eased to long leg
Boland to du Plessis, FOUR runs good length and outside off, Faf takes it on the up and drives it crisply through square cover
Boland to du Plessis, 1 run angled towards leg stump again, clipped around the corner for one
Boland to Rossouw, 1 run length ball around off, steered down to third man
Boland to du Plessis, no run back of a length and angled in at off, chopped towards point
Zampa to Rossouw, 1 run sliding away outside off, pushed through the covers on the back foot

Zampa to du Plessis, no run there was a noise. Did he nick it behind? Smith is quite excited. Not given, and the Australian captain wants a review. Sharp legbreak from Zampa, starts outside off and rips away further. Wade can't pouch it, Smith catches it on the rebound. Faf missed it by a long way. The noise perhaps came from Faf's bat hitting his pad
Zampa to du Plessis, no run floated up on middle, defended
Zampa to du Plessis, 1 run quicker legbreak outside off, punched through the covers
Zampa to Rossouw, no run slower through the air on middle, defended
Zampa to Rossouw, no run sliding legbreak, negotiated off the back foot
Marsh to du Plessis, FOUR runs dragged short and outside off, du Plessis sizes up the half-tracker and nails a pull to the right of short midwicket
Marsh to du Plessis, no run chopped to backward point
Marsh to du Plessis, FOUR runs too full and outside off, Faf crashes it disdainfully through the covers
Marsh to Behardien, no run greets him with a lifter outside off, ducks under it
Marsh to Behardien, 2 runs bursts through the hands of Tremain at short midwicket. Fractionally short on off, rocks back and pulls. Tremain leaps, but can't hang onto the chance
Zampa to Rossouw, no run legbreak, turns back in, punched down the ground
Zampa to Rossouw, 1 run floated full on middle, secures an easy single to wide mid-off
Zampa to Behardien, no run tossed up full at off, played back to Zampa
Zampa to Behardien, no run skids on flat on off, blocked on the back foot
Zampa to Behardien, FOUR runs lobs a full-toss outside off, eased in the gap between covers and mid-off
Zampa to Behardien, no run pushed through on middle and leg, hangs back and defends to the man under the helmet
Marsh to Rossouw, no run back of a length and angled in on off from round the wicket, blocked back to the bowler
Marsh to Rossouw, no run floated full and outside off, front-foot drive to extra-cover
Marsh to Rossouw, 1 run leans back and chops a short ball from outside off to sweeper cover
Marsh to Behardien, no run lifter, flies through into the gloves of Wade as FB ducks under
Marsh to Behardien, 1 run short on leg stump, pulled down to fine leg
Marsh to Rossouw, 1 run back of a length and outside off, placed to sweeper cover
Zampa to Rossouw, 1 run too full and outside off, driven to mid-off's right
Zampa to Behardien, 1 run jabbed to mid-on for one
Zampa to Rossouw, no run tossed-up legbreak, blocked in front of leg stump
Zampa to Rossouw, no run flat and full on middle, whipped to midwicket
Zampa to Rossouw, no run lobbed up on leg stump, not much turn, defended on the front foot
Zampa to Rossouw, FOUR runs sees some flight, dashes down the track and clouts it over wide mid-on
Hastings to Behardien, no run back of a length and outside off, plays with an angled bat and misses
Hastings to Behardien, 2 runs takes it from outside off and controls a pull to deep midwicket
Hastings to Behardien, no run back of a length and just outside off, punched to mid-off
Hastings to Behardien, 1 run short and outside off, glides a single to third man
Hastings to Rossouw, no run back of a length on the stumps, shuffles across in defence
Hastings to Rossouw, FOUR runs short and outside off, jumps on top of the bounce and flays it through cover-point
Zampa to Behardien, 1 run low full toss on off, patted down to mid-on for a hurried single. The fielder splatters the stumps at the non-striker's end, but FB is well in. He clutches his hamstring
Zampa to Rossouw, no run slides on outside off, punched to extra-cover
Zampa to Rossouw, FOUR runs South Africa soar to 4-0. The birthday boys - Rossouw and FB - finish it off. Rossouw soars down the track, drills it against the turn through the covers
Thanks for your company and comments. Keep sending them in. Do come back for the final ODI. Until then, this is Deiva signing off on the behalf of Nikhil and Raghav.

4.20pm Rossouw raises his bat, the crowd laps him up. Faf claps the batsmen off. SA rested as many as three first-choice bowlers, but still wiped out Australia for 167 inside 37 overs. Abbott led the way with the new ball, Shamsi with the older one. Stand-in captain Faf then anchored the modest chase with his second fifty-plus score of the series. The hosts are now set for a whitewash of Australia. Can they become the first team to
South Africa won by 6 wickets (with 87 balls remaining)
Player of the match is Kyle Abbott, SA
